c74object.name: bach.omtree2bachtree
c74object.digest: Convert an OpenMusic rhythmic tree into a bach rhythmic tree
c74object.description: Converts a rhythmic tree in OpenMusic form into the proper Measureinfo and Duration tree readable by bach.score.

outlet.digest: The bach Measureinfo corresponding to the input tree
The bach Durations (in tree form) corresponding to the input tree

method.name: bang
method.description: Perform the conversion on the most recently received input data.

method.name: llll
method.digest: Take the incoming OpenMusic-formatted rhythmic tree and convert it

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the followings:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message.
x: disabled output (nothing is output)
p: 'portal' output: only used by bach.portal to intercept the @out attribute specified while creating the abstraction (see bach.portal).
The native output is recommended, unless communication with standard Max messages is needed. Disabling unused outputs can be useful if extreme optimization of the patch is needed.
llllobj_class_add_check_attr(c, LLLL_OBJ_VANILLA);

c74object.discussion: If you connect the object to bach.score, don't forget to set the bach.score @treehandling attribute to 0 (Take For Granted) and @maketreecompatiblewithts attribute to 0, if you wish all rhythmic levels to be kept exactly the same as the OpenMusic levels! Otherwise, as usual, bach will process the tree according to the mode you had defined via the @treehandling attribute, and possibly reboxes your rhythm if your maketreecompatiblewithts is 1.

entry.name: Outlet 1 (llll)
entry.description: The bach Measureinfo corresponding to the input tree.

entry.name: Outlet 2 (llll)
entry.description: The bach Durations (in tree form) corresponding to the input tree.

entry.name: More details
entry.description: If you connect the object to bach.score, don't forget to set the bach.score @treehandling attribute to 0 (Take For Granted) and @maketreecompatiblewithts attribute to 0, if you wish all rhythmic levels to be kept exactly the same as the OpenMusic levels! Otherwise, as usual, bach will process the tree according to the mode you had defined via the @treehandling attribute, and possibly reboxes your rhythm if your maketreecompatiblewithts is 1.

entry.name: Keywords
entry.description: rhythmic tree, tree, rhythm, convert, OpenMusic, measureinfo, duration.
